p: 11. The referral-structure of a job (2), cont.: How nature is present in the thing being made. Here “nature” means nature as usable rather than nature as “just out there” or “the power of nature.” We can nature as an “objective element” of the tool and the product, but that requires abstracting from nature as useful and turning it into an object of theory. Doing so conceals the relation of nature as enthralling, overpowering, and useful. This happens, for example, when we study the flowers in our garden from the perspective of a botanist.
